name: Ground Beef Empanadas
author: Praha3
summary: These ground beef empanadas are always a hit at potlucks and picnics, even when lukewarm. Many of the specialty ingredients (sofrito, adobo, sazon, frozen empanada discs) can be bought in regular grocery stores, or you can make the sofrito or empanada dough yourself.
ingredients: 1 (1.41 ounce) package sazon seasoning with achiote
½ teaspoon adobo seasoning, or more to taste
directions: Heat vegetable oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Heat olive oil in a pan over medium-high heat
Saute onion, garlic, and sofrito in the hot oil for about 2 minutes
Add ground beef, sazon, Italian seasoning, black pepper, and cumin; cook and stir until beef is browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes
Add olives and sprinkle with adobo to taste
Place empanada discs on a flat surface that has been lightly dusted with flour
Roll the sides of the discs out slightly
Place 1 1/2 tablespoons of the meat filling into the center of each disc
Wet the edges of the discs with water and fold each into a half-moon shape
Pinch the sides of the empanadas closed using a fork
Deep-fry empanadas in the hot oil until golden brown, working in batches if needed, about 4 minutes on each side
